image.altText: Man in blue coat walking behind man in tan coat and scarf with stone building behind them.

props.synopsis: After telling police officers in his home that "relationships will obviously have their moments where there's tension", a Tasmanian supreme court judge found himself charged with assault and emotional abuse or intimidation.

title.children: How a judge became the judged, from the moment police knocked on his front door

image.altText: A red football sits on the grass next to Hobart Cenotaph.

props.synopsis: The head of Tasmania's RSL says his organisation has been "disrespected and misled at every turn" by the government and the architectural firm behind the planned Hobart stadium — warning a structure of its size will "desecrate" the "sacred" location of the nearby cenotaph.

title.children: RSL says it has been 'deceived and misled' about Macquarie Point stadium proposal by Tasmanian government

image.altText: A dark-haired woman wearing floral statement earrings and black blazer walks up the entrance ramp of a metallic building.

props.synopsis: A former Miss Australia and ex-Tasmanian MP has denied allegations of punching and slapping her former husband, telling him to kill himself, and preventing him from seeing his parents in day four of alleged assault case.

title.children: Former Tasmanian MP denies telling husband to 'kill himself', court hears

image.altText: a person wearing jackets walks on a snow-covered mountain at Ben Lomond National Park, Northern Tasmania.

props.synopsis: A cold front is forecast to bring hail, snow, rain and winds of up to 90 kph, prompting a number of severe weather warnings from Adelaide to Victoria's north-eastern alps, and NSW's Illawarra region.

title.children: Hazardous weather across Australia's south-east to bring strong winds, hail, rain and snow

image.altText: A Windows PC shwing a "Blue Screen of Death" error.

props.synopsis: Friday afternoon felt frighteningly similar to the 12-minute mark in a disaster movie. The difference is that in the movie, a villain is pulling the strings, but in reality, the culprit was far closer to home.

title.children: The global tech crash opened like a Hollywood disaster film. So, how does it end?

image.altText: A woman holding a bunch of flowers.

props.synopsis: As industry experts continue to grapple with how a suspected defect in a computer update brought the world to a halt, Australians recount how the incident unfolded.

title.children: 'At least the coffee shop's open': Australians' 'frustrating' Friday amid IT outage

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: Joe Biden is insistent on staying in the presidential race, despite a growing thrum of concern among senior Democrats who say he may not be able to defeat Donald Trump in the 2024 election.

title.children: Biden campaign insists he will stay in presidential race, amid growing calls to stand down

image.altText: JD Vance smiles, raises his left hand places his right hand over his heart as he walks out on a stage.

props.synopsis: The CFMEU's history gives us a window into Australia's economic, political and industrial landscape over the past 40 years.

title.children: The history of the CFMEU weirdly sheds light on JD Vance and our upcoming 'critical decade'

image.altText: People move around below a blank sign in a Berlin airport

props.synopsis: Seemingly all at once, millions of computers around the world became unusable and unable to be rebooted, showing what's known in the industry as the "Blue Screen of Death".

title.children: How a bug in a little-known piece of software caused a global meltdown

image.altText: Stacey and Nathaniel Train on their wedding day, with Nathaniel's brother Gareth.

props.synopsis: Background Briefing can reveal that Australia's first alleged Christian terrorists forged their fateful bond years ago following an explosive family rift.

title.children: 'Bewildered': Trio made shocking allegations against parents years before deadly ambush

image.altText: An altered mugshot shows the mysterious Hamas military commander Mohammed Deif, who is known as The Guest.

props.synopsis: A leading Hamas military commander in Gaza has survived multiple Israeli attempts to kill him, but after a recent massive strike on what Israeli military said was a militant compound, they may have finally gotten their man — now all they need is evidence.

title.children: Israel has tried to assassinate 'The Guest' seven times. Here's how his luck may have finally run out

image.altText: A map showing Australia with pins/

props.synopsis: Over the last 120 years, Australia's population has become more diverse, increasingly urbanised, older and less likely to have children. That's according to new demographic data issued by the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Twelve charts that show how Australia's population changed over 120 years

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: Here's what we know about the IT outage affecting users around Australia and the world.

title.children: Australians have been hit by a worldwide tech outage. Here's what we know

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a bandage on his ear, pumps his fist and walks off stage

props.synopsis: Seven days ago, a defiant Joe Biden was refusing calls to withdraw from this year's election while Donald Trump prepared for a huge rally ahead of the Republican National Convention. And then everything changed.

title.children: This week will go down as a chaotic chapter in US political history. What just happened?

image.altText: A woman wearing a traditional Indian outfit drinking a glass of champagne

props.synopsis: How do you sum up the experiences of Australia's second-largest migrant population in one book? Growing Up Indian In Australia editor Aarti Betigeri speaks on the dangers of assuming all Indians had the same upbringing.

title.children: How do you sum up the experiences of Australia's second-largest population group in one book?

image.altText: Four young people scoop curry and rice out of pots and bowls.

props.synopsis: With an uncertain future in rentals and campus accommodation, these Canberra students have turned to co-operative living.

title.children: In one of Australia's most expensive cities, Ben pays just $187 a week in rent after embracing co-operative housing

image.altText: Jason Day

props.synopsis: Jason Day holds Australia's hopes in his hands at The Open as awful conditions see all but two Aussies miss the cut for the third round.

title.children: Carnage for Australia at The Open as Jason Day plays a lone hand to keep hopes alive at Royal Troon

image.altText: A cyclist wearing all yellow rides on a mountain road through applauding crowds.

props.synopsis: Slovenian superstar Tadej Pogačar increases his Tour de France lead on Jonas Vingegaard to all but lock up his third title.

title.children: '100 per cent perfect': Pogačar's grip on Tour de France looks impossible to overcome for rival

image.altText: The buildings of the Ashley Youth Detention Centre sit behind a tall fence.

props.synopsis: A detainee at Tasmania's only youth detention centre wrote to the premier last year, claiming the young detainees feel like "dogs at the dogs' home" and are not being given a chance to turn their lives around.

title.children: Child's letter from notorious prison says 'even cows in the paddocks next to Ashley have more freedom than us'

image.altText: Jessica Mauboy wearing a light green jumpsuit sitting down against a dark green background, long hair, hand on chin

props.synopsis: When Jessica Mauboy's family gathered for a reunion, their family tree expanded to include one of Australia's most famous Olympians.

title.children: The family reunion that uncovered a link between Jessica Mauboy and Cathy Freeman

image.altText: A grinning Adelaide AFL player raises his thumbs above his head in celebration after a big goal.

props.synopsis: The Crows hit the front from a Josh Rachele goal with under a minute to go, but a knee injury to a key player sours the victory.

title.children: Crows damage Essendon's finals hopes in a thriller but knee injury to key player dampens the victory

image.altText: Risdon Prison, Tasmania

props.synopsis: A doctor who recommended a Tasmanian inmate spend more time in hospital for their own safety was banned from entering the prison the following day for "security" reasons, a report has found.

title.children: Doctor who defied Tasmanian prison over inmate's health banned from prison the next day, report finds

image.altText: A white man wearing a white shirt and suit jacket holding a red card illustrated with black eyes over his eyes

props.synopsis: No one was allowed to see Nicolas Cage's face as Longlegs before the film was released. Is it really terrifying or just marketing bluster?

title.children: No one was allowed to see Nicolas Cage's face as Longlegs before the film's release. Is it that scary?

image.altText: Senior woman looking at her wedding photo. Album below in her lap.

props.synopsis: You've probably been warned against dwelling on the past, but revisiting fond memories can improve the physical and mental wellbeing of older people. Here are some tips you can use to connect with your loved ones.

title.children: 'My mum's a storyteller': How interviewing your older loved ones can be therapeutic

image.altText: Mary Fowler celebrates with Caitlin Foord

props.synopsis: With Sam Kerr sidelined, Mary Fowler will take centre stage for the Matildas during the team's upcoming Olympic campaign.

title.children: Mary Fowler's spotlight admission ahead of starring role for Matildas at Paris Olympics

image.altText: Beef, broccoli and chilli stir fry with spring onions in a fry pan, ready to serve and eat.

props.synopsis: It's easy to make beef and broccoli at home, and this version includes chilli and sesame. Buttery, garlic rice makes it even more delicious.

title.children: Love beef and broccoli? This version has chilli, sesame and buttery garlic rice

image.altText: A woman holds a toddler next to a man and a dog in between a row of trees

props.synopsis: Ditching corporate lives in busy cities, these tree changers are moving to rural Tasmania in search of a different life.

title.children: 'Nothing better in the world': City dwellers ditch the rat race and find fulfilment in the Tasmanian countryside

image.altText: A young man with a shaved head looks calm as he sits behind glass in a court dock wearing a blue checked shirt.

props.synopsis: Russian prosecutors alleged that Evan Gershkovich had gathered secret information on the orders of the CIA about a company that manufactures tanks for Moscow's war in Ukraine, allegations he and his employer denied.

title.children: Russian court jails Wall Street Journal reporter for 16 years after convicting him of espionage

image.altText: Two emergency service officers in an area cordoned off by red tape

props.synopsis: The Israeli army reviews a blast in central Tel Aviv which made it through the IDF's aerial defences, with Yemen's Houthi militants claiming responsibility for a "military operation" in the city.

title.children: Yemen's Houthis claim military operation in Tel Aviv as IDF investigates explosion

image.altText: A man in a suit surrounded by lights

props.synopsis: In a 92-minute speech, Donald Trump used Joe Biden's name only once, and asked a roaring crowd of party faithful to send him back to the White House. Meanwhile, the president endured another day of leaks and anonymous sources citing pressure for him to drop out of the race.

title.children: 'Blood everywhere': Trump describes shooting and Melania returns, as Republican Convention reaches crescendo

image.altText: A woman stands on the side of a dirt road near buildings and flashing a V-sign with her fingers at a military vehicle driving by

props.synopsis: The world's highest court issues an opinion that describes Israel's actions as a breach of the Geneva Convention and other international law.

title.children: Top UN court says Israeli occupation of Palestinian territories is illegal

image.altText: The cast of 1985 movie St Elmo's Fire sitting around a table

props.synopsis: I dived with glee back into a cherished chapter of my youth with the documentary Brats, made by former teen star Andrew McCarthy about the 1980s rise of teen movies and their young talents who came to be known as the Brat Pack.

title.children: Brats is a searing examination of 1980s fame — and a lesson in taking control of your life
